citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The facility has provided social grouping and enrichment items for their birds, within their enclosures. However, a written
plan has not been documented and approved by the attending veterinarian. The written plan is necessary to show that the
facility is providing their birds environmental enhancements to promote their psychological health and well-being.
Facility must provide a veterinary approved program of environmental enhancement for its birds and said plan must be
made available to APHIS upon request.
Dealers, exhibitors, and research facilities must develop, document, and follow a species-appropriate plan for
environment enhancement adequate to promote the psychological well-being of birds. The plan must be approved by the
attending veterinarian and must be in accordance with the regulations in this subpart and with currently accepted
professional standards as cited in appropriate professional journals or reference guides.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “B" license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection(s) or by February 9, 2025 or the applicant will forfeit the license
fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
3.154 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
The facility has provided social grouping and enrichment items for their birds, within their enclosures. However, a written 
plan has not been documented and approved by the attending veterinarian. The written plan is necessary to show that the 
facility is providing their birds environmental enhancements to promote their psychological health and well-being. 
 
Facility must provide a veterinary approved program of environmental enhancement for its birds and said plan must be 
made available to APHIS upon request. 
 
Dealers, exhibitors, and research facilities must develop, document, and follow a species-appropriate plan for 
environment enhancement adequate to promote the psychological well-being of birds. The plan must be approved by the 
attending veterinarian and must be in accordance with the regulations in this subpart and with currently accepted 
professional standards as cited in appropriate professional journals or reference guides. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “B" license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection(s) or by February 9, 2025 or the applicant will forfeit the license 
fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires. 
 
 n
